docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [[[Keyword_Opposed|Opposed]]] Brawl [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], [Unarmed], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You square off against your opponent and hit them with a punch.

To use Unarmed Strike, your opponent must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]].

Outcome Description Glitch You miss and are [[[Condition_Off_Balance|Off Balance]]] Fade You deal [[[Keyword_Minimum_Damage|Minimum Damage]]] to them Success You deal [[[Keyword_Normal_Damage|Normal Damage]]] to them Cool Success You deal [[[Keyword_Maximum_Damage|Maximum Damage]]] to them and they are [Off Balance]

docs.title: Silent Takedown [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Brawl [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [Unarmed], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]] [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You swiftly and silently close in on your opponent and execute a maneuver to quietly subdue them before they have time to react.

To use Silent Takedown, you must be [[[Condition_Undetected|Undetected]]], and your opponent must be [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]]. When you use this trick, you silently [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]] [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] to them and roll Silent Takedown.

Outcome Description Glitch You fumble the maneuver, lose [[[Condition_Undetected|Undetected]]], and are [[[Condition_Off_Balance|Off Balance]]] Fade They are [[[Condition_Stunned|Stunned]]] but cry out, alerting anyone [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]] Success They are [Stunned] Cool Success They are [[[Condition_Unconscious|Unconscious]]]

docs.title: City Culture [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Moderate (14) Culture [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]]

You know this city like the back of your hand.

When you use City Culture, you ask the GM a question related to the city you're in. For example, discovering a clue may lead you to ask, What do I know about the PRISM nightclub? or What is the '12th Annual Rose Festival' that we read about? Have I ever heard of that before? The scope of this trick is limited to information about the city and its inhabitants.

Outcome Description Glitch You don't know and you are [[[Condition_Confused|Confused]]] Fade The GM answers the question and you are [Confused] Success The GM answers the question Cool Success The GM answers the question and provides extra info

docs.title: Corporate Culture [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Culture [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]]

You are plugged in to the corporate world of cutthroat business.

When you use Corporate Culture, you ask the GM a question related to corporations, what they provide, business processes, c-suite execs, scandals, lawsuits, etc. For example, you might ask, What do I know about Knifepoint Capital? or What corporations have a beef with Knifepoint Capital?

Outcome Description Glitch You don't know and you are [[[Condition_Confused|Confused]]] Fade The GM answers the question and you are [Confused] Success The GM answers the question Cool Success The GM answers the question and provides extra info

docs.title: Milsec Culture [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Culture [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]]

You are well aware of the equipment, tactics, and methods employed by milsec personnel.

When you use Milsec Culture, you ask the GM a question related to military and security organizations, weapons, tactics, teamwork, security, crowd control, and black ops. For example, you might ask, What's a typical response for this corp's security guards? Are they going to shoot first and ask questions later? Are these guards well trained or just scrubs with guns?

Outcome Description Glitch You don't know and you are [[[Condition_Confused|Confused]]] Fade The GM answers the question and you are [Confused] Success The GM answers the question Cool Success The GM answers the question and provides extra info

docs.title: Street Culture [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Culture [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]]

You know where to go and what to do to survive on the street.

When you use Street Culture, you ask the GM a question related to gangs (colors, territory, leadership, factions), squatting, scavenging, stealing, and drugs. For example, Where is the nearest homeless camp or Do I recognize those gang colors? What do I know about the Sick Vultures gang?

Outcome Description Glitch You don't know and you are [[[Condition_Confused|Confused]]] Fade The GM answers the question and you are [Confused] Success The GM answers the question Cool Success The GM answers the question and provides extra info

docs.title: Underworld Culture [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Culture [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]]

You know that beneath the glitz and glam of the city lies a thriving and dangerous underworld.

When you use Underworld Culture, you ask the GM a question related to organized crime, including the Mafia, Yakuza, and Jo-Pok. For example, an encounter with the Yakuza may make you wonder, What interest does the Yakuza have in Knifepoint Capital? or Who is in charge of the Yakuza in this city? The scope of this trick is limited to information about organized criminal enterprise, organization hierarchy and membership, and areas of influence.

Outcome Description Glitch You don't know and you are [[[Condition_Confused|Confused]]] Fade The GM answers the question and you are [Confused] Success The GM answers the question Cool Success The GM answers the question and provides extra info

docs.title: Bluff [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Deception [[[Keyword_Attitude|Attitude]]], [[[Keyword_Language|Language]]], [[[Keyword_Social|Social]]], [[[Keyword_Vocal|Vocal]]]

With a straight face, you tell a lie, obscure the truth, or omit key details to deceive the person you're talking to.

Outcome Description Glitch They become [Suspicious] Fade They believe you (but are unsure) and gain [Suspicious] Success They believe you Cool Success They believe you and you are [[[Condition_Inspired|Inspired]]]

docs.title: Misdirect [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Deception [[[Keyword_Attitude|Attitude]]], [[[Keyword_Language|Language]]], [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]]. [[[Keyword_Social|Social]]], [[[Keyword_Vocal|Vocal]]]

Whether by shouting and pointing or simply by talking and using one hand, you momentarily distract your opponent.

To use Misdirect on an opponent, they must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] or [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]]. If the target has an [Attitude] of Hostile towards you, raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Glitch They become [Suspicious], and they gain [[[Condition_Confident|Confident]]] Fade They are [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]] and they become [Suspicious] Success They are [Distracted] Cool Success They are [Distracted] and you are [[[Condition_Inspired|Inspired]]]

docs.title: Disguise [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Deception [[[Keyword_Advanced_Supplies|Advanced Supplies]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Supplies|Supplies]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]]

Using clothing, makeup, and props, you create a disguise that makes you unrecognizable.

When you use Disguise, you use [[[Keyword_Supplies|Supplies]]] or [[[Keyword_Advanced_Supplies|Advanced Supplies]]] to create the desired look. [Advanced Supplies] allow you replicate another person's appearance and raise the DL by one. This trick takes one hour to complete. If you rush, raise the DL by one and it takes 30 minutes.

Outcome Description Glitch Unusable disguise, your time and [[[Keyword_Supplies|Supplies]]] or [[[Keyword_Advanced_Supplies|Advanced Supplies]]] are wasted Fade NPCs are automatically [Suspicious] and roll Threat vs. Moderate (14) DL to see through it Success A [Suspicious] NPC rolls Threat vs. Hard (20) DL to see through it Cool Success A [Suspicious] NPC rolls Threat vs. Severe (26) DL to see through it and you are [[[Condition_Inspired|Inspired]]]

docs.title: Forgery [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Deception [[[Keyword_Advanced_Supplies|Advanced Supplies]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Tools|Tools]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]]

You use special tools and materials to fabricate a forgery designed to fool people into thinking it's the real thing.

When you use Forgery, you use [[[Keyword_Tools|Tools]]] and [[[Keyword_Advanced_Supplies|Advanced Supplies]]] to create a replica of a mundane, non-electronic object. This trick takes an hour to complete. Replicating an object that is intricate or expensive raises the DL by one and takes 24 hours to complete, though those hours need not be consecutive.

Outcome Description Glitch Unusable forgery, your time and [[[Keyword_Advanced_Supplies|Advanced Supplies]]] are wasted Fade NPCs are automatically [Suspicious] and roll Threat vs. Moderate (14) DL to recognize it's a forgery Success A [Suspicious] NPC rolls Threat vs. Hard (20) DL to recognize it's a forgery Cool Success A [Suspicious] NPC rolls Threat vs. Severe (26) DL to recognize it's a forgery and you are [[[Condition_Inspired|Inspired]]]

docs.title: Impersonate [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Deception [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]], [[[Keyword_Language|Language]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Social|Social]]], [[[Keyword_Vocal|Vocal]]]

By altering your voice, facial expressions, and even the way you sit or stand, you convincingly impersonate another person.

You can use Impersonate to trick someone into thinking you are someone else. If you have only verbal communication with your opponent, you can trick them with Impersonate alone. However, if you want to impersonate someone in the presence of others, you also need to use Disguise. If you got a Cool Success on your Disguise roll, lower the DL for Impersonate by one.

Outcome Description Glitch They don't believe you, their [[[Keyword_Attitude|Attitude]]] worsens, and they become [[[Condition_Confident|Confident]]] Fade They believe you (but remain unsure) and they become [Suspicious] Success They believe you Cool Success They believe you and you gain an [[[Condition_Ally|Ally]]]

docs.title: Avoid Crash [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Drive [[[Keyword_Drone|Drone]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

In a split second, you react to an oncoming hazard and swerve to avoid a crash.

When you are driving a [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] at [[[Keyword_High_Speed|High Speed]]] and a sudden obstacle or hazard appears on the road ahead or if your vehicle [[[Keyword_Crashes|Crashes]]] for another reason, you can use a [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]] to use Avoid Crash. The [[[Keyword_Handling|Handling]]] of your [Vehicle] applies to the DL of your Avoid Crash roll. If you use only [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Glitch Your [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] [[[Keyword_Crashes|Crashes]]] Fade You avoid the obstacle or hazard (near miss) and you are [[[Condition_Shaken|Shaken]]] Success You avoid the obstacle or hazard Cool Success You avoid the obstacle or hazard and are [[[Condition_Inspired|Inspired]]]

docs.title: Chase [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Drive [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You spot the car you're chasing up ahead and rapidly accelerate to catch up.

When you use Chase, you identify a target [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] ahead of you ([[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]] or [[[Keyword_Far|Far]]]). If the other [Vehicle] is traveling at [[[Keyword_High_Speed|High Speed]]], you must do the same (which raises the DL by one). If the other [Vehicle] is [Far] away, raise the DL by one. The [[[Keyword_Handling|Handling]]] of your [Vehicle] applies to the DL of your Chase roll. If you use only [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Glitch You fall behind and are [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]] and the other [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] may use Escape Fade You [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]] [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] to the other [Vehicle] and you are [Distracted] Success You [Move] [Close] to the other [Vehicle] Cool Success You [Move] [Close] to the other [Vehicle] and may overtake (get ahead) if desired

docs.title: Escape [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Drive [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

When your opponent falls behind, you seize the opportunity and drive your car out of sight to lose them completely.

When you are driving a [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] that's the target of a Chase and your opponent falls behind, you may use a [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]] to Escape. The [[[Keyword_Handling|Handling]]] of your [Vehicle] applies to the DL of your Lose Them roll. If you use only [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Glitch Your [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] takes 3 damage and the other [Vehicle] is [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] behind you Fade You get away, the chase ends, and your [Vehicle] takes 3 damage Success You get away and the chase ends Cool Success You get away, the chase ends, and you are [[[Condition_Inspired|Inspired]]]

docs.title: Sideswipe [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Moderate (14) Drive [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You pull up alongside another driver and then violently swerve into them, damaging both of your vehicles.

To use Sideswipe, your [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] to the other [Vehicle]. The [[[Keyword_Handling|Handling]]] of your [Vehicle] applies to the DL of your Sideswipe roll. If you use only [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Glitch You miss them, your [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] takes 10 damage, and you are [[[Condition_Shaken|Shaken]]] Fade Both your and their [Vehicle] take 10 damage Success Their [Vehicle] takes 15 damage and yours takes 5 damage Cool Success Their [Vehicle] takes 20 damage and the other driver is [Shaken]

docs.title: Driving Stunt [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Drive [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

When you're behind the wheel, you are capable of pulling off daring high-speed stunts that threaten to break the laws of physics.

To use this trick, you must be driving a [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] at [[[Keyword_High_Speed|High Speed]]] (but this does not raise the DL as it normally would). When you use Driving Stunt, state your desired outcome, such as I want to jump the draw bridge while it's opening or I want to tilt my car so it's almost on its side and I can go through a narrow alley. If you only use [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]] with Driving Stunt, raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Glitch Your [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] [[[Keyword_Crashes|Crashes]]] Fade You get the desired outcome but your [Vehicle] takes 5 damage Success You get the desired outcome Cool Success You get the desired outcome and you are [[[Keyword_Lucky|Lucky]]]

docs.title: Pit Maneuver [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [[[Keyword_Stability|Stability]]] Drive [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

Pit Maneuver is an aggressive driving move designed to disable your opponent's vehicle and bring it to a stop.

To use Pit Maneuver, your [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] to the other [Vehicle]. The [[[Keyword_Handling|Handling]]] of your [Vehicle] applies to the DL of your Pit Maneuver roll. If you use only [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Glitch You miss and they [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]] [[[Keyword_Far|Far]]] away Fade Both your and their [[[Keyword_Vehicle|Vehicle]]] take 10 damage, spin out, and stop Success Their [Vehicle] takes 10 damage, spins out, and stops Cool Success Their [Vehicle] [[[Keyword_Crashes|Crashes]]]

docs.title: Pit Maneuver Sidebar
docs.text: You maneuver your vehicle alongside so your front is lined up with the other vehicle's rear end. Then you use your vehicle to strike the rear quarter panel of the other vehicle with the intent of causing it to spin out and for the other driver to lose control.

docs.title: Burst Fire [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Firearms [[[Keyword_Gun|Gun]]], [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You grip your weapon and issue a three-round burst.

When you use Burst Fire, your target must be at the [[[Keyword_Optimal_Range|Optimal Range]]] for your weapon. If they are at a different range, raise the DL by one. You may use [[[Keyword_Spray|Spray]]] to hit an additional target. If you use [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], raise the DL by one. Use your weapon's Burst Fire [[[Keyword_Damage_Array|Damage Array]]] with this trick.

Outcome Description Glitch Weapon jam or out of ammo. You must spend 1 AP to use this weapon again. Fade You deal [[[Keyword_Minimum_Damage|Minimum Damage]]] Success Choose to either deal [[[Keyword_Normal_Damage|Normal Damage]]] or make them [[[Condition_Suppressed|Suppressed]]] Cool Success You deal [[[Keyword_Maximum_Damage|Maximum Damage]]] and they are [Suppressed]

docs.title: Full Auto [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Severe (26) Firearms [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [[[Keyword_Gun|Gun]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You hold the trigger and lay down a continuous stream of hot lead.

When you use Full Auto, your target must be at the [[[Keyword_Optimal_Range|Optimal Range]]] for your weapon. If they are at a different range, raise the DL by one. You may use [[[Keyword_Spray|Spray]]] to hit up to four additional targets (five total). Use your weapon's Full Auto [[[Keyword_Damage_Array|Damage Array]]] with this trick.

Outcome Description Glitch Weapon jam or out of ammo. You must spend 1 AP to use this weapon again. Fade You deal [[[Keyword_Minimum_Damage|Minimum Damage]]] Success You deal [[[Keyword_Normal_Damage|Normal Damage]]] and they are [[[Condition_Suppressed|Suppressed]]] Cool Success You deal [[[Keyword_Maximum_Damage|Maximum Damage]]] and they are [Suppressed]

docs.title: Single Shot [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Moderate (14) Firearms [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [[[Keyword_Gun|Gun]]], [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]], [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You point your gun and shoot.

When you use Single Shot, your target must be at the optimal range listed for your weapon. If they are at a different range, raise the DL by one. If you use [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], lower the DL by one. Use your weapon's Single Shot [[[Keyword_Damage_Array|Damage Array]]] with this trick.

Outcome Description Glitch Weapon jam or out of ammo. You must spend 1 AP to use this weapon again. Fade You deal [[[Keyword_Minimum_Damage|Minimum Damage]]] Success You deal [[[Keyword_Normal_Damage|Normal Damage]]] Cool Success Choose to deal [[[Keyword_Maximum_Damage|Maximum Damage]]] or deal [Normal Damage] and make a free [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]]

docs.title: Crippling Shot [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Firearms [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [[[Keyword_Gun|Gun]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You take careful aim and target one of your opponent's legs with your shot.

When you use Crippling Shot, your target must be at the same range as the optimal range listed for your weapon. If they are at a different range, raise the DL by one. Use your weapon's Single Shot [[[Keyword_Damage_Array|Damage Array]]] with this trick.

Outcome Description Glitch Weapon jam or out of ammo. You must spend 1 AP to use this weapon again. Fade You deal [[[Keyword_Minimum_Damage|Minimum Damage]]] Success You deal [[[Keyword_Normal_Damage|Normal Damage]]] and they gain [[[Condition_Movement_Restricted|Movement Restricted]]] Cool Success You deal [[[Keyword_Maximum_Damage|Maximum Damage]]] and they gain [[[Condition_Movement_Impaired|Movement Impaired]]] and [[[Condition_Prone|Prone]]]

docs.title: Dual Shot [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Firearms [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [[[Keyword_Gun|Gun]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You blast away with two guns, one in each hand.

To use Dual Shot, you must be equipped with two pistols or SMGs. You may target the same opponent or two different opponents who are [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]] to one another. Your opponent(s) must be at your weapons' [[[Keyword_Optimal_Range|Optimal Range]]]. If at least one opponent is at a different range, raise the DL by one. When you use [Dual Shot], make only one roll and use only one [Damage Array]. If your weapons have a Single Shot [[[Keyword_Damage_Array|Damage Array]]] you may use it to calculate damage. If your weapons have a Burst Fire [Damage Array], you may use it instead, but doing so raise the DL by one, and you must declare your intent to use Burst Fire prior to making your roll. Both weapons must use the same mode, Single Shot or Burst Fire.

Outcome Description Glitch One weapon jams or out of ammo. You must spend 1 AP to use this weapon again. Fade If you had one target, they take [[[Keyword_Normal_Damage|Normal Damage]]]If you had two targets, they each take [[[Keyword_Minimum_Damage|Minimum Damage]]] Success If you had one target, they take [[[Keyword_Maximum_Damage|Maximum Damage]]]If you had two targets they each take [Normal Damage] Cool Success If you had one target, they take double [Maximum Damage] If you had two targets, they each take [Maximum Damage]

docs.title: Disable Device [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [[[Keyword_Security|Security]]] Tech [[[Keyword_Fine_Control|Fine Control]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Tools|Tools]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You inspect the device's electronic guts and make a calculated choice to snip one of the wires. A second later, the maglock disengages, and the door opens with a hiss.

Disable Device is a hands-on activity that requires you to directly interact with the target's hardware. If you do not have proper [[[Keyword_Tools|Tools]]], raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Glitch You fail, have [[[Condition_Vision_Impairment|Vision Impairment]]], and trigger a [[[Keyword_Security_Alert|Security Alert]]] Fade The device is [[[Keyword_Disabled|Disabled]]] and you have [Vision Impairment] Success The device is [Disabled] Cool Success The device is [Disabled] and you gain a [[[Keyword_Secret|Secret]]]

docs.title: Cybernetic Hack [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [[[Keyword_Security|Security]]] Tech [[[Keyword_Cyber_Rig|Cyber Rig]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Wireless|Wireless]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

With the right module installed, peoples' cyberware can be added to your cyber rig's AR overlay. Selecting one of the cybernetic implants in your field of view runs the module and attempts to disable the target.

To use Cybernetic Hack on an opponent, they must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] or [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]].

Outcome Description Glitch You have no access and trigger a [[[Keyword_Security_Alert|Security Alert]]] Fade Their implant is [[[Keyword_Disabled|Disabled]]] and you have [[[Condition_Stress|Stress]]] vs. [[[Keyword_Security|Security]]] Success Their implant is [Disabled] Cool Success Choose for their implant to be [Disabled] or [[[Keyword_Enabled|Enabled]]] and you are an [[[Keyword_Admin|Admin]]]

docs.title: Droptrip [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [[[Keyword_Security|Security]]] Tech [[[Keyword_Cyber_Rig|Cyber Rig]]], [[[Keyword_Datajack|Datajack]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Condition_Unaware|Unaware]]]

When you enter an address and jack in, your cyber rig overrides your senses and drops you into the network foam, the lowest layer of the Net. By navigating a digital hallucination, you can gain unauthorized access to the remote system.

Outcome Description Glitch You have no access and trigger a [[[Keyword_Security_Alert|Security Alert]]] Fade You are an [[[Keyword_Operator|Operator]]] and have [[[Condition_Stress|Stress]]] vs. [[[Keyword_Security|Security]]] Success You are an [Operator] Cool Success You are an [[[Keyword_Admin|Admin]]]

docs.title: Street Hack [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [[[Keyword_Security|Security]]] Tech [[[Keyword_Cyber_Rig|Cyber Rig]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]], [[[Keyword_Wireless|Wireless]]]

Your type in the command and your cyber rig spins up, creating an AR overlay of the world around you. By selecting one of the color-coded devices in your field of view, you execute the hack.

To use Street Hack, the device must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] or [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]].

Outcome Description Glitch You have no access and trigger a [[[Keyword_Security_Alert|Security Alert]]] Fade You are an [[[Keyword_Operator|Operator]]] and have [[[Condition_Stress|Stress]]] vs. [[[Keyword_Security|Security]]] Success You are an [Operator] Cool Success You are an [[[Keyword_Admin|Admin]]]

docs.title: Read Person [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Moderate (14) Insight [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You surmise information about a person by studying them, the way they speak, the clothes they're wearing, their facial expressions, and body language.

When you use Read Person, ask the GM to identify a person's current emotional state, immediate goals, or way of thinking. To use Read Person on someone, they must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] or [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]].

Outcome Description Glitch You do not learn any information and you are [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]] Fade GM gives you information and you are [Distracted] Success GM gives you information Cool Success GM gives you information and you gain a [[[Keyword_Secret|Secret]]]

docs.title: Sense Lies [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Insight [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]], [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]], [[[Keyword_Auditory|Auditory]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

By listening to the speaker's words and tone and reading their body language, you sense that they are lying.

When someone speaks, you may use a [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]] to Sense Lies. If you are unable to see the speaker, raise the DL by one. The scope of Sense Lies is one statement You must roll Sense Lies again each time you want to determine if a statement is a lie.

Outcome Description Glitch You don't know if they lied and you are [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]] and [[[Condition_Confused|Confused]]] Fade You know if they lied and you are [Distracted] Success You know if they lied Cool Success You automatically know if they're lying for the rest of the scene

docs.title: Trick Insight Core Size Up Opponent
Size Up Opponent [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Moderate (14) Insight [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You perform a mental assessment of an opponent's combat prowess, taking into account all information you can see, such as their weapons, cyberware, armor, insignias or tattoos, and the way they carry themselves.

To use Size Up Opponent on someone, they must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] or [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]].

Outcome Description Glitch You do not learn their Threat bonus they are [Suspicious] Fade GM tells you their Threat bonus and they are [Suspicious] Success GM tells you their Threat bonus Cool Success GM tells you their Threat bonus, Wits and Fort

docs.title: Dodge [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Fort Insight [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You sense the attack almost before you see it and deftly sidestep and duck out of harms way.

When you are hit by a [[[Keyword_Melee|Melee]]] [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], you may use a [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]] to [Dodge].

Outcome Description Glitch You take the hit and are [[[Condition_Prone|Prone]]] Fade Their [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]] is [[[Keyword_Downgraded|Downgraded]]] and you are [[[Condition_Off_Balance|Off Balance]]] Success Their [Attack] is [Downgraded] Cool Success Their [Attack] is [Downgraded] and you [[[Keyword_Counterattack|Counterattack]]]

docs.title: Coerce [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Fort Intimidate [[[Keyword_Language|Language]]], [[[Keyword_Social|Social]]], [[[Keyword_Vocal|Vocal]]]

With threats of damage to income, reputation, or bodily health, you force your victim to comply with your instructions.

If your instructions would put the target or their loved ones in a dangerous situation, raise the DL by one. They will outright refuse instructions that would result in certain death or serious injury.

Outcome Description Glitch They are not intimidated, their [[[Keyword_Attitude|Attitude]]] worsens, and they [[[Condition_Break|Break]]] Fade They are [[[Condition_Compliant|Compliant]]] and you have [[[Condition_Stress|Stress]]] vs. Fort Success They are [Compliant] Cool Success They are [[[Condition_Servile|Servile]]]

docs.title: Mock [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Intimidate [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]], [[[Keyword_Language|Language]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Social|Social]]], [[[Keyword_Vocal|Vocal]]]

You hone in on your opponent's insecurities and ruthlessly mock them, undermining their confidence.

To use Mock on an opponent, they must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] or [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]].

Outcome Description Glitch They are unaffected by your words and become [[[Condition_Confident|Confident]]] Fade You are both [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]] and their [[[Keyword_Attitude|Attitude]]] worsens Success They are [Distracted] and their [[[Keyword_Attitude|Attitude]]] worsens Cool Success They are [Distracted] and you are [[[Condition_Inspired|Inspired]]]

docs.title: Frighten [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Fort Intimidate [[[Keyword_Language|Language]]], [[[Keyword_Social|Social]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]], [[[Keyword_Vocal|Vocal]]]

You turn to an individual and look them in the eye. Maybe you say a few words, or you might just let your body language do the talking. Regardless, they are left broken from the brief exchange.

If you use Frighten without speaking, raise the DL by one. You cannot use this trick on someone who is currently suffering from a [[[Condition_Break|Break]]].

Outcome Description Glitch They are not scared of you and they gain [[[Condition_Confident|Confident]]] Fade They [[[Condition_Break|Break]]] and [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]] you Success They [Break] and flee Cool Success They faint and are rendered [[[Condition_Unconscious|Unconscious]]]

docs.title: Shakedown [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Fort Intimidate [[[Keyword_Language|Language]]], [[[Keyword_Social|Social]]], [[[Keyword_Vocal|Vocal]]]

By making veiled threats to your victim, you make them see that it's in their best interests to give you a "gift."

You can suggest what you would like to receive, but the GM is not obligated to have the NPC grant you a specific [Gift.]

Outcome Description Glitch They are not intimidated, their [[[Keyword_Attitude|Attitude]]] worsens, and they [[[Condition_Break|Break]]] Fade They give you a minor [[[Keyword_Gift|Gift]]], their [[[Keyword_Attitude|Attitude]]] worsens, and they gain [[[Condition_Confident|Confident]]] Success They give you a regular [Gift] Cool Success They give you an expensive [Gift] and a [[[Keyword_Secret|Secret]]]

docs.title: Shred [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Intimidate [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]], [[[Keyword_Language|Language]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Social|Social]]], [[[Keyword_Vocal|Vocal]]]

You have perfected the art of the verbal takedown, and your words cut to the bone.

To use Shred on an opponent, they must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] or [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]].

Outcome Description Glitch They are unaffected by your words and become [[[Condition_Confident|Confident]]] Fade They are [[[Condition_Stunned|Stunned]]], their [[[Keyword_Attitude|Attitude]]] worsens, and you are [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]] Success They are [Stunned] and their [[[Keyword_Attitude|Attitude]]] worsens Cool Success They are [Stunned] and [[[Condition_Shaken|Shaken]]]

docs.title: First Aid [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Stabilization DL Medicine [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Supplies|Supplies]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

When a friend falls in combat or suffers from another treatable condition, you rush to their side and use your medical knowledge to stabilize them.

If you use First Aid without [[[Keyword_Supplies|Supplies]]] raise the DL by one.

Outcome Description Glitch They take 2 damage and gain [[[Condition_Bleeding|Bleeding]]] Fade They are [[[Condition_Stabilized|Stabilized]]] and you have [[[Condition_Stress|Stress]]] vs. [[[Keyword_Stabilization_DL|Stabilization DL]]] Success They are [Stabilized] and gain 2 hp Cool Success They are [Stabilized] and heal 2 hp + your Medicine bonus

docs.title: Medical Assessment [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Medicine [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You provide your medical opinion of a patient, a corpse, or a set of medical records.

When you use Medical Assessment, ask the GM a medical question related to the subject, such as What was the approximate time of death? or Do I know what this disease is or how to cure it? Taking extra time to perform a thorough Medical Assessment can lower the DL by one (GM's discretion.

Outcome Description Glitch You don't know and you are [[[Condition_Confused|Confused]]] Fade The GM answers the question and you are [Confused] Success The GM answers the question Cool Success The GM answers the question and you gain a [[[Keyword_Secret|Secret]]]

docs.title: Cybernetic Installation [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Medicine [Concentrate], [[[Keyword_Location|Location]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]]. [[[Keyword_Supplies|Supplies]]], [[[Keyword_Surgical_Procedure|Surgical Procedure]]], [[[Keyword_Tools|Tools]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

Surgery might be more glamorous, but knowing how to install cyberware saves just about as many lives in the sprawl.

You cannot use Cybernetic Installation on someone who is [[[Condition_Bleeding|Bleeding]]], [[[Condition_Traumatized|Traumatized]]], or in [[[Condition_Critical_Condition|Critical Condition]]]. The patient must be [[[Condition_Stabilized|Stabilized]]] with First Aid to remove those conditions before Cybernetic Installation can be performed. You may install multiple pieces of cyberware on the same target during the same [[[Keyword_Surgical_Procedure|Surgical Procedure]]], but you must roll separately for each one. It does not matter the order you install them in. You cannot use this trick on yourself.

Outcome Description Glitch They take 10 damage and gain [[[Condition_Bleeding|Bleeding]]] Fade The cyberware is installed and you have [[[Condition_Stress|Stress]]] vs. [[[Keyword_Stabilization_DL|Stabilization DL]]] Success The cyberware is installed Cool Success The cyberware is installed and they are healed 10 hp

docs.title: Surgery [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords By Injury Medicine [Concentrate], [[[Keyword_Location|Location]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]]. [[[Keyword_Supplies|Supplies]]], [[[Keyword_Surgical_Procedure|Surgical Procedure]]], [[[Keyword_Tools|Tools]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

When you pick up your scalpel and enter the surgical theater, it is no exaggeration to say that you save lives.

Refer to the injury's description to determine the DL for using Surgery to treat it and to see if it qualifies for Surgery in the field. If you perform Surgery in the field, raise the DL by one. You cannot use Surgery on someone who is [[[Condition_Bleeding|Bleeding]]], [[[Condition_Traumatized|Traumatized]]] or in [[[Condition_Critical_Condition|Critical Condition]]]. The patient must be [[[Condition_Stabilized|Stabilized]]] with First Aid to remove those conditions before Surgery can be performed. You may treat multiple injuries on the same target during the same surgical session, but you must roll separately for each one. It does not matter the order you treat them in. You cannot use this trick on yourself.

Outcome Description Glitch They take 10 damage and gain [[[Condition_Bleeding|Bleeding]]] Fade The injury is removed and you have [[[Condition_Stress|Stress]]] vs. [[[Keyword_Stabilization_DL|Stabilization DL]]] Success The injury is removed and they gain [[[Condition_Recovering|Recovering]]] Cool Success The injury is removed, they gain [Recovering], and they are healed 10 hp

docs.title: Melee Strike [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [[[Keyword_Opposed|Opposed]]] Melee [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [Melee], [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You attack your opponent by viciously swinging or thrusting your melee weapon at them.

To use Melee Strike, your opponent must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]].

Outcome Description Glitch You miss and are [[[Condition_Off_Balance|Off Balance]]] Fade You deal [[[Keyword_Minimum_Damage|Minimum Damage]]] to them Success You deal [[[Keyword_Normal_Damage|Normal Damage]]] to them Cool Success You deal [[[Keyword_Maximum_Damage|Maximum Damage]]] to them and they are [[[Condition_Prone|Prone]]]

docs.title: Dazzling Strike [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [[[Keyword_Opposed|Opposed]]] Melee [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [Melee], [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You strike at your opponent's eyes, temporarily obscuring their vision.

To use Dazzling Strike, your opponent must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]].

Outcome Description Glitch You miss and are [[[Condition_Off_Balance|Off Balance]]] Fade They are [Visually Impaired] Success You deal [[[Keyword_Minimum_Damage|Minimum Damage]]] to them and they are [Visually Impaired] Cool Success You deal [Minimum Damage] to them and they are [[[Condition_Blinded|Blinded]]]

docs.title: Finishing Move [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [[[Keyword_Opposed|Opposed]]] Melee [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]], [[[Keyword_Melee|Melee]]], [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You sense your opponent's weakness and use your weapon to finish them.

When an opponent who is [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] or [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]] goes from [Fine] to [Hurting], you can react. You [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]] to the opponent, if they are not already [Close], and roll Finishing Move.

Outcome Description Glitch You miss and are [[[Condition_Off_Balance|Off Balance]]] Fade You deal [[[Keyword_Minimum_Damage|Minimum Damage]]] Success You deal [[[Keyword_Normal_Damage|Normal Damage]]] Cool Success They are dead

docs.title: Leaping Strike [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [[[Keyword_Opposed|Opposed]]] Melee [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]], [Melee], [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]], [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You get a running start, fall from above, or swing in on a rope to perform a mid-air strike.

To use Leaping Strike, first make a basic Athletics roll with a DL of Moderate (14). If you fail, you fall [[[Condition_Prone|Prone]]] and your action ends. Otherwise, you automatically [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]] through the air to a [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]] opponent by jumping, swinging, or falling, for example, and roll Leaping Strike.

Outcome Description Glitch You miss and fall [[[Condition_Prone|Prone]]] Fade You deal [[[Keyword_Minimum_Damage|Minimum Damage]]] to them Success You deal [[[Keyword_Normal_Damage|Normal Damage]]] to them Cool Success You deal [[[Keyword_Maximum_Damage|Maximum Damage]]] to them and they are [Prone]

docs.title: Search [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Perception [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You move about and study your surroundings for hidden people or objects.

When you use Search, define the scope of your search to the GM, such as I want to search the desk, I want to see if anyone has a weapon, or I want to scan the rooftops for people. If you physically interact with the subject of your search, lower the DL by one. For example, if you're looking for weapons on someone, and you include a physical pat-down as part of your Search, the DL is lowered by one.

Outcome Description Glitch You find something unpleasant and you are [[[Condition_Shaken|Shaken]]] Fade The GM tells you what you find (if anything) and you are [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]] Success The GM tells you what you find (if anything) Cool Success The GM tells you what you find (if anything) and you learn a [[[Keyword_Secret|Secret]]]

docs.title: Dead Eye [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Perception [[[Keyword_Gun|Gun]]], [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]] [Ranged], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You zero in on your opponent and raise your gun. One heartbeat later, you send hot lead their way.

To use Dead Eye on an opponent, they must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] or [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]]. If you are wielding a pistol, lower the DL by one.

Outcome Description Glitch Your next [[[Keyword_Gun|Gun]]] [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]] you make on anyone this turn is [[[Keyword_Downgraded|Downgraded]]] Fade Your next [Gun] [Attack] you make on them this turn is [[[Keyword_Upgraded|Upgraded]]] and you are [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]] Success The next [Gun] [Attack] you make on them this turn is [Upgraded] Cool Success The next [Gun] [Attack] you make on them this turn is is an automatic [Cool Success]

docs.title: Overwatch [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Perception [[[Keyword_Auditory|Auditory]]], [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]], [[Keyword_Language|Language]], [Verbal], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You survey the combat zone and relay relevant information to your crew, noting the positions and movements of friends, enemies, and civilians.

When you use Overwatch, pick one ally in the same battle as you. The ally must have hands-free wireless comms (headset or cyberware) to benefit from this trick.

Outcome Description Glitch They get no benefit and you are [[[Condition_Confused|Confused]]] Fade Their next [[[Keyword_Attack|Attack]]] is [[[Keyword_Upgraded|Upgraded]]] and you are [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]] Success Their next [Attack] is [Upgraded] Cool Success Their next [Attack] is [Upgraded] and they gain 1 [[[Keyword_Temporary|Temporary]]] [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]]

docs.title: Read Lips [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Hard (20) Perception [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]], [[[Keyword_Language|Language]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You focus on a person's lips as they speak and though you cannot hear them, you understand what they are saying.

To use Read Lips, the person speaking must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] or [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]]. The scope of Read Lips is one sentence (or a few short sentences.) You must roll Read Lips again each time you want to decipher what the person said.

Outcome Description Glitch You don't know what they said and they become [Suspicious] Fade You know what they said and they become [Suspicious] Success You know what they said Cool Success Read Lips is an automatic Success on them for the rest of the scene

docs.title: Captivate [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Persuade [Attitude], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Social|Social]]], [[[Keyword_Visible|Visible]]]

With a simple change in posture, a strut in your step, or a flick of your hair, you can put on "the look" that makes everyone sit up and take notice.

To use this trick, the opponent(s) must be [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] or [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]]. If there are multiple onlookers, use the highest Wits amongst the [[[Keyword_Group|Group]]].

Outcome Description Glitch They are not impressed and suffer a [[[Condition_Break|Break]]] Fade They are [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]] and their [Attitude] worsens Success They are [Distracted] Cool Success They are [[[Condition_Bewildered|Bewildered]]] and you gain an [[[Condition_Ally|Ally]]]

docs.title: Convince [Core Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Persuade [[[Keyword_Attitude|Attitude]]], [[[Keyword_Language|Language]]], [[[Keyword_Social|Social]]], [[[Keyword_Vocal|Vocal]]]

By appealing to the other person's sensibilities, you find a way to convince them to help you or to see things from your point of view.

Outcome Description Glitch They are unconvinced and their [Attitude] worsens Fade They agree (with some reservations) and they gain [[[Condition_Confident|Confident]]] Success They agree Cool Success They agree and their [Attitude] improves

docs.text:

With a combination of confidence, market knowledge, and a bit of savvy, you negotiate over the price of goods or services.

In some situations, such as when you purchase from a fixed-price vendor, it is not possible to use Haggle. Attempting to Haggle with someone who has a Hostile [Attitude] towards you automatically fails.

Outcome Description Glitch You get 20% worse price and their [Attitude] worsens Fade You get 20% better price and their [Attitude] worsens Success You get 20% better price Cool Success You get 20% better price and a [[[Keyword_Gift|Gift]]]

With a well-timed joke, an unexpected song, or a captivating story, you entertain those around you..

Having piloted your drone to its destination, you carefully position it and deploy its payload.

To use Deploy Payload, the spot where you want to drop your payload, called the mark, must be [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]]. When you use Deploy Payload, describe the mark, such as I want to place the package in front of the door, or I want to drop the grenade on the truck.

docs.text:

Sitting on the side of the road, you remotely pilot a drone and use it to collect intel on your target.

When you use Drone Recon to scout a location, state the scope of your search, such as I want to fly up to the 38th floor and see if I can find the room we're looking for, or I want to do a flyover of the area and see where the security guards are stationed. The Difficulty Level is based on the [[[Keyword_Security|Security]]] of the airspace you are in.

Outcome Description Glitch You [[[Keyword_Fly|Fly]]] the [[[Keyword_Drone|Drone]]] [[[Keyword_Far|Far]]], it triggers a [[[Keyword_Security_Alert|Security Alert]]] and is [[[Condition_Jammed|Jammed]]] Fade You [Fly] the [Drone] [Far], the GM tells you what you find, and you have [[[Condition_Stress|Stress]]] vs. [[[Keyword_Security|Security]]] Success You [Fly] the [Drone] [Far] and the GM tells you what you find Cool Success You [Fly] the [Drone] [Far], the GM tells you what you find, and you learn a [[[Keyword_Secret|Secret]]]

docs.title: Drone Piloting Sidebar
docs.text: You connect your control deck to a drone over wireless and create a 3D Tactical Hologram (TDTH) using its cameras. Flying a drone is cognitively demanding and requires intense focus. To ensure they can concentrate, some pilots convert TDTH to VR and wear a headset to block out all potential distractions. Others go a step further and send the signal straight to their brains using a datajack.

docs.title: Initiate Countermeasures [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords [[[Keyword_Security|Security]]] Piloting [[[Keyword_Concentrate|Concentrate]]], [[[Keyword_Control_Deck|Control Deck]]], [[[Keyword_Datajack|Datajack]]], [[[Keyword_Drone|Drone]]], [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Two_Hands|Two Hands]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]], [[[Keyword_Wireless|Wireless]]]

Your control deck lights up with alerts. Someone is trying to jam your signal. You react by engaging your drone's electronic countermeasures and manually calibrating them to thwart the jam attempt

When your drone is [[[Condition_Jammed|Jammed]]], you may use a [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]] to Initiate Countermeasures.

Outcome Description Glitch Your drone is [[[Condition_Jammed|Jammed]]] and you are [[[Condition_Confused|Confused]]] Fade The [Jammed] condition is removed and you have [[[Condition_Stress|Stress]]] vs. [[[Keyword_Security|Security]]] Success The [Jammed] condition is removed Cool Success The [Jammed] condition is removed and you are [[[Keyword_Lucky|Lucky]]]

You use your drone's manipulator arm to open doors, use a keypad, or pick up an object, just like you would use your own.

To use Manipulate Object, your [[[Keyword_Drone|Drone]]] must be outfitted with a [[[Keyword_Manipulator_Arm|Manipulator Arm]]]. When you use Manipulate Object, state the action you want to perform, such as I want use my drone to type the security code into the keypad, or I want my drone to pick up the pistol and put it in its cargo bay.

Outcome Description Glitch You are unsuccessful and [[[Condition_Confused|Confused]]] Fade You use the [[[Keyword_Manipulator_Arm|Manipulator Arm]]] successfully and you are [Confused] Success You use the [Manipulator Arm] successfully Cool Success You use the [Manipulator Arm] successfully and you are [[[Condition_Inspired|Inspired]]]

You fly your drone low and fast, firing its automatic weapons to rain down lead on your opponents.

To use Strafing Run, your [[[Keyword_Drone|Drone]]] must be outfitted with an automatic weapon. You may target up to three opponents with Strafing Run, all of which must be [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]] your [Drone] and each other. Use the weapon's Full Auto [[[Keyword_Damage_Array|Damage Array]]] with this trick.

By moving slowly and quietly and by staying behind cover and out of sight, you sneak to your destination.

To use Sneak, you must be [[[Condition_Undetected|Undetected]]] by the people you're avoiding. If multiple observers are present, use the highest Wits amongst them.

docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Stealth [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

By capitalizing on a sudden distraction, you slip away with not even a whisper.

When one or more observers [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] to you become [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]], you may use a [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]] to Disappear.

docs.title: Pickpocket [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Stealth [[[Keyword_Fine_Control|Fine Control]]], [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_One_Hand|One Hand]]], [[[Keyword_Range|Range]]], [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

You exploit a moment of distraction to steal a small item from a person's pocket, wrist, or finger.

When someone who is [[[Keyword_Close|Close]]] to you becomes [[[Condition_Distracted|Distracted]]], you may use a [[[Keyword_Reaction|Reaction]]] to use Pickpocket. You may optionally use this trick to Reverse Pickpocket, which allows you to plant an item on a person rather than steal one from them. Instead of targeting a person, you may also use Pickpocket to discretely lift or drop a [[[Keyword_Small_Item|Small Item]]] from an unattended surface that is [Close], such as a palming a key off a desk or dropping a knife in a waste basket. If multiple observers are present, use the highest Wits among them.

docs.title: Shadow Target [Signature Trick]
docs.text:
Difficulty Level (DL) Skill Keywords Wits Stealth [[[Keyword_Physical|Physical]]], [[[Keyword_Visual|Visual]]]

To be an effective tail, you must leave enough distance between yourself and the target, or else you risk being noticed. At the same time, you must stay close enough that you can keep them in your sights.

To use Shadow Target you must be [[[Condition_Undetected|Undetected]]] by the person you are following. The scope of Shadow Target includes the distance from one [[[Keyword_Location|Location]]] to another. Every new destination along the target's route requires another Stealth roll. You may use Shadow Target with any mode of transport, such as on foot, bicycle, or vehicle.

Outcome Description Glitch You lose [[[Condition_Undetected|Undetected]]] and their [Attitude] drops one level Fade You follow them to a [[[Keyword_Location|Location]]], are [Undetected] and have [[[Condition_Stress|Stress]]] vs. [[[Keyword_Wits|Wits]]] Success You follow them to a [Location] and are [Undetected] Cool Success You follow them to a [Location] and are [[[Condition_Hidden|Hidden]]]

docs.title: Round Robin: The Flow of the Game
docs.text:
This game uses a round robin turn-taking style for all scenes and actions, including those in combat and out of combat. In fact, in terms of player facetime with the GM, this game makes no distinction between combat and non-combat turns.

It is possible for some players to be in combat while other players are not. This does not alter the turn order. The game will always proceed in a round robin manner, even if that means you end up with a mix, such as, one player takes a turn in combat, the next player takes a turn outside of combat, and the last player takes a turn in a different combat.

This game is designed to allow players to have their characters act independently from one another without forcing anyone to "sit out" until one group's actions have been resolved. Instead, this game blends everyone's actions together in an orderly way by requiring everyone to take turns.

docs.title: Turn Etiquette
docs.text:
Players should generally avoid interrupting other players on their turns. However, if one player narrates an action that would directly impact another player, the GM may allow the second player to react directly before returning to the first player. Any reaction by a second player should be minimal to preserve the first player's turn.

If you are unsure of what to do on your turn, the GM may also prompt you with a question or two to help you identify possible actions your character could take. However, you are not required to take an action on your turn. You may pass.

docs.title: Turn Length
docs.text: Whether you are working with regular turns or combat turns, the players and GM should strive to keep the game moving. Players should expect each turn to last no more than five minutes. The only real exception to this is group turns, which can last considerably longer if the entire crew is together. However, if one or two characters are off doing their own thing individually while the rest have a group turn together, the general rule of five minutes per turn stands. The GM should always be cognizant of all players at the table and try to make sure everyone gets the opportunity to act.

docs.title: Turn Order
docs.text:
Each time your group assembles, whether online or in person, to play the game, the GM will start by setting the stage, reminding everyone of the events of last session, and so on.

Play begins with the player to the GM's left. They describe what their character does, and the GM responds accordingly. Then, play proceeds to the left and the next player takes a turn, and so on, until everyone has taken a turn, and play comes back to the GM.

It is not necessary to maintain the same turn order from session to session, and players are free to choose different seats at the start of each session. On the other hand, some groups may prefer a consistent order and will choose to keep their same seats every session.

docs.title: Action Points
docs.text: At the start of your turn, you get 3 Action Points (AP), which you can spend to take actions, such as to draw a weapon, [[Keyword_Move|Move]], or use a trick. On your turn, each action you take costs 1 AP. You cannot save AP turn over turn. If you decide to end your turn without spending all three AP, you lose the remainder (though they will refresh as normal at the start of your next turn)

docs.title: Types of Turns
docs.text: There are four types of turns in this game: out-of-combat turns, combat turns, group turns, and GM turns. This game makes no mechanical distinction between out-of-combat and in-combat turns. However, it may be easier to think of turns that way.

docs.title: Out-of-Combat Turns
docs.text:
During an out-of-combat turn, you might tell the GM your character wants to sneak into the warehouse you learned about from your contact. The GM sets the scene, and you describe what your character is doing. You decide to hop the fence, and the GM calls for an [[Skills_and_Tricks/Trick_Athletics_Core_Athletic_Move|Athletic Move]] roll (1 AP). As you cautiously approach the warehouse, the GM calls for a [[Skills_and_Tricks/Trick_Stealth_Core_Sneak|Sneak]] roll (1 AP) to avoid being noticed by the patrolling guards. Last, you use [[Skills_and_Tricks/Trick_Hacking_Core_Disable_Device|Disable Device]] (1 AP) to override the electronic lock on the door. Those three actions used your 3 AP. If you want to go inside and explore further, you'll have to wait until your next turn.

The GM is not required to call for any rolls during your turn, and it's important to remember [[When_to_Roll|When to Roll]]. Out-of-combat turns can feel less structured than combat turns and rely on both the GM and player to regulate the amount of time spent.

docs.title: Combat Turns
docs.text: During a combat turn, the types of actions may be different, but the process works the same way. If you [[[Keyword_Move|Move]]] to an area [[[Keyword_Nearby|Nearby]]] (1 AP), draw your weapon (1 AP), and use [[Skills_and_Tricks/Trick_Firearms_Core_Burst_Fire|Burst Fire]] to attack an enemy (1 AP), you have spent a total of 3 AP, and your turn ends. At the start of your next turn, your AP will refresh, and you can take three more actions.

docs.title: Group Turns
docs.text:
When the group is partially or completely together in the same place at the same time, the GM is free to drop individual turns in favor of group turns. Group turns offer a loose, collaborative segment in which players share their ideas and narrate their character's actions without a formal turn order. This is a great time to let the players show off their characters' personalities and quirks, and it lets them roleplay with one another.

Group turns are especially useful when time is compressed or actions are routine, such as when the characters travel together across the city, a trip that could take a couple of hours or more. If players prefer to stay in the round robin turn order during group scenes, that is perfectly fine. Some players may want the opportunity to narrate what their character is doing during this moment of downtime.

Anyone not part of these group turns should still be given their individual turns, whether regular or combat.

docs.title: GM Turns
docs.text: When play comes back to the GM, it signals a potential escalation. The GM can use their turn to introduce new characters into a scene, whether in combat or not. The GM should also use their turn to run the opposition against those who are in combat.

docs.title: Your Turn
docs.text: On your turn, you tell the GM what you want your character to do. You can also ask questions of the GM or other players, whether their characters are with you or not. While in-game actions and dice rolls are shared openly, players are expected to keep their characters' knowledge separate. Just because you heard it, doesn't mean your character did.
